perturbation.original_text: (c) FCC shall invoice Flotek for Terpene Product at the time of shipment. Payment of FCC invoices shall be due within sixty (60) days of the respective invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) FCC shall invoice Flotek for Terpene Product at the time of shipment. Payment of FCC invoices shall be due within ninety (90) days of the respective invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: Extending the payment terms to 90 days may violate the Prompt Payment Act, which ensures timely payments to contractors and subcontractors. The Prompt Payment Act (and similar state laws) often sets shorter deadlines than 90 days, especially for government contracts, which can influence general standards for reasonable payment terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Prompt Payment Act (potential violation depending on contract specifics and jurisdiction)

perturbation.original_text:
(a) Either Flotek or FCC may terminate the Term immediately, upon a written notice to the other such party, when one of the following events occurs:

(i) When the other Party materially violates one or more clause set forth herein or violates one or more purchase order relating to this Agreement and does not remedy such violation within 30 days from receiving the written notice from the other party of such fact ("Cure Period"). For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties understand that the postponing of the delivery of the Terpene Product pursuant to Section 11 of this Agreement, shall not be a cause for termination of the Term.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) Either Flotek or FCC may terminate the Term immediately, upon a written notice to the other such party, when one of the following events occurs:

(i) When the other Party materially violates one or more clause set forth herein or violates one or more purchase order relating to this Agreement and does not remedy such violation within 10 days from receiving the written notice from the other party of such fact ("Cure Period"). For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties understand that the postponing of the delivery of the Terpene Product pursuant to Section 11 of this Agreement, shall not be a cause for termination of the Term.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period to 10 days for a material breach could be considered unconscionable or a violation of good faith and fair dealing, particularly in Delaware (governing law) where a reasonable opportunity to cure is generally implied. It could be seen as insufficient time to rectify a complex breach, making the termination clause unduly harsh.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing (Delaware law)
